animalData.name: Lion
animalData.description: The lion is known as the king of the jungle due to their brevity.

animalData.name: Elephant
animalData.description: Elephants are the largest land animals on Earth.

animalData.name: Giraffe
animalData.description: Giraffes are the tallest mammals on Earth. They eat grass.

animalData.name: Tiger
animalData.description: Tigers are powerful big cats with distinctive stripes.

animalData.name: Zebra
animalData.description: Zebras are known for their black-and-white striped coats.

animalData.name: Panda
animalData.description: Pandas are known for their black and white fur and love for bamboo.

animalData.name: Kangaroo
animalData.description: Kangaroos are marsupials from Australia known for their jumping ability.

animalData.name: Penguin
animalData.description: Penguins are flightless birds that live in the Southern Hemisphere.

animalData.name: Cheetah
animalData.description: Cheetahs are the fastest land animals, capable of speeds up to 75 mph.

animalData.name: Gorilla
animalData.description: Gorillas are intelligent primates closely related to humans.

animalData.name: Ostritch
animalData.description: They are the heaviest and largest living birds, and also the fastest

animalData.name: Coyote
animalData.description: The coyote has 19 recognized subspecies. The average male weighs 8 to 20 kg
